ACLU of GA and our partners are working to monitor critical elections this November. We need YOUR help!

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We invite you to join us as well as partners Common Cause Georgia, Georgia Coalition for the People's Agenda, and the Lawyers Committee for Civil Rights Under Law as we work to protect our elections this November 5. We've kept you updated on the many ways voters saw their right to access the ballot suppressed in 2018 and we plan to prevent this in 2019 and beyond. We need YOUR help to succeed.

On November 5, voters across the state will take to the polls to elect their local leaders – from mayors to city council and beyond. Local elections are critical in setting up for success for all of our localities.

However, in seven counties, election officials will be testing new voting procedures – including new voting machines that will soon be used in every county in the state. The success of these first elections is critical in setting up 2020 elections where all voters are able to access their ballot. That's why ACLU of GA, Common Cause Georgia, and the Georgia Coalition for the People's Agenda will be monitoring these sites with support from the national voter protection hotline run by the Lawyer's Committee.

We need YOU to join us as an election protection volunteer! We'll be monitoring paper ballot elections in Cobb County, as well as new machine elections in Bartow, Carroll, Catoosa, Decatur, Lowndes, and Paulding Counties. There may be additional opportunities for monitoring in Athens-Clarke and Clayton counties as well.

No prior experience is needed – all volunteers will be provided with training. Local volunteers are highly encouraged.

Can't make it in person? We'll also be making calls to encourage voter turnout in these counties from a metro-Atlanta location – and we could use your voice throughout the day.

To volunteer for either in-person monitoring or get-out-the-vote calls, please contact volunteers@acluga.org.

Voters who face suppression on Election Day can call 866-Our-Vote to be connected with immediate assistance.

The success of our elections is up to all of us, and we can't do this without you!

Correction: an earlier version of this email left off our critical partners in this effort. We are proud to partner with Common Cause Georgia, Georgia Coalition for the People's Agenda and the Lawyers Committee for Civil Rights Under Law on this project.

For Justice,

Christopher Bruce, Esq.
Political Director, ACLU of Georgia
